Review.Titre: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER
Review.Contenu: Honestly, where do I start? I put my phone number in for a quote and not even two seconds later someone called me and was trying to upsell me a million things. On top of that she wouldn’t let me hang up even though I stated CLEARLY 4-5 times that I was not interested. Then I email the company and they have nothing to say except we’re sorry. BUT here’s the kicker. Right after the email I sent where I was discussing what I did not like specifically about them calling me immediately; they send me a survey request - it says on the email: “  I was happy to see that you had a good experience with us :)” are you serious? Does anyone know what’s going on in that company? Outrageous pricing, bad customer service, no internal communications; completely just ridiculous to be honest. Do not use this company unless you want to be bombarded by them and never get a moment of peace. I asked them TWICE to remove me from all emails and they notified me they did and then they sent me an email AGAIN about my ‘great experience’. Thank you for saving me the hassle of emailing again. I hope others find this review helpful.

Review.Titre: They are constantly trying to upsell…
Review.Contenu: They are constantly trying to upsell you as you try to set up your company. Even after paying them, they send you emails daily trying to get you to pay them more for information you can get for free if you just put a little work into it. My biggest gripe is that I let them know that I didn't plan on doing business for a few months and was still convinced to sign up even though this costs me a minimum of $800 in tax liabilities for having an LLC one month (December) of the year. I found this out and called the company back in less than an hour. They said they would hold off sending in my application, but then I received a notification in the early AM that my application was sent in against my wishes. I would not recommend this company to a friend or an enemy. Look into doing this yourself and save lots of money.

Seriously who calls someone 3 times back to back to back and expects them to be happy about it?  Sounds like spiteful children on the phone when I call to me.

Review.Titre: COMPLETE SCAM / AVOID!
Review.Contenu: COMPLETE SCAM / AVOID!Don't trust them to establish your LLC, they are a clever and complete scam on their website and especially on the phone.They'll call you straight after you start your application by "helping" you but they actually rip off your credit card without your consent. I've never experienced such a nasty scam before. Here's how to make it yourself for much cheaper:"LLC" registration: they're using another agent: Registered Agent Solutions Inc, it costs only 99$ if you do it directly with them. TB charges you 298$ for that... "EIN": you can do that online for free: IRS website (tailorbrands will just forward you an incomplete pre-filled PDF file, which you'll have to fax yourself anyway, and they'll make you pay 300$... just for the SS-4 form which you can download for free on IRS!!"License guidance"; completely useless, approx 99$"Legal documents" 119$ just a few Word file templates which you can get for free after 1min search online (service agreement, non-compete agreement, marketing agreement etc.)And still they'll try to sell you a tax compliant scheme for min 600$.So basically if you do it yourself it might cost around 99$. They charged me 800+ and I'm so upset getting scammed by them.

Review.Titre: Stay away from this company

Review.Contenu: Ordered business cards and they came back with the grey panel much lighter than the images shown online, there was almost no definition. After raising this with TB they advised I should order a “white card as the ones supplied are marginally cream” Tried to do this but there was no white option when trying to reorder. Contacted TB again and they advise that “it wasn’t an option” but they could make my logo darker to show up. 1) You don’t mess around with your corporate colours 2) the logo was fine as it was 3) the logo wasn’t on the grey area I was complaining about. They refunded the cost as a gesture which didn’t solve my problem. I’m now reluctant to order any more marketing material in case the colours are not accurate. * It is worth noting the adviser did their very best and was just relaying back what they were being told. It’s the company to blame. Disappointed customer.

Review.Titre: Waste of my time and money, and now more of my time.
Review.Contenu: I hired them to set up to register a business for me and they happily took money of $299.  I paid for the expedited process and then after two weeks of not hearing from Tailorbrands, I began to ask what was going on.  I was told oh, "It's in process" on several calls and emails.  After two more weeks, I broke down and called the state to find out what the problem was.  The state had actually denied my application before I ever called Tailorbrands the first time to find out what the hold-up was.  I ended up spending several hours writing emails, waiting on hold, speaking with representatives, being told someone would call me back, and when they did call me back they said that someone else was looking into the matter for me and would call me... I never received a call back explanation, it was always pass the hot potato.  Now that I had called the state and found out my name was too close to my previous business name I knew why there was a hold up.  It actually took them a while to figure it out and it wasn't until I started asking for a refund did they bother to come up with an excuse to state some policy that they cannot give me my money back.  No one in their customer service department has any authority to work with the customers, and their managers must have been instructed to not work with the customers and to delay or pass off any responsibility to billing which has no number per the managers.  The real kicker for me was when I was told "I want to make sure that your concern is taken care of, so I've sent your email to our relevant team for a closer look and they'll be in touch with you soon to help you out."  What the Heck-Fire is a "Relevant Team"?  Let that sink in.If your business set up has any complications getting set up, Good Luck.

Review.Titre: WARNING! Do not work with Tailor Brands.
Review.Contenu: I rarely write reviews, but when I do, it is usually when I am extremely pleased with the services. However, this time I feel the need to warn people so that they don't encounter the same problem I did. Tailor Brands is a company that makes many promises and uses a lot of words, but when it comes to taking action, they respond with the statement 'we are not able to give you legal advice.' Essentially, they become unresponsive when you need help. However, they will persistently call you to sell you additional products that they claim you absolutely need. It is important to note that their prices are competitive. So, when you see their appealing price of only $300 for opening your LLC, be prepared to add another $400 to it. I have requested a full refund because they charged me for providing help with obtaining my EIN number, but no one actually assisted me. As a result, it is impossible for me to have an LLC without an EIN. On top of all this, it has been over a month, and I have been patient. This is a scam! Additionally, when paying for their services, be cautious of discounted prices. You will ultimately be charged the full price. For example, when I purchased the EIN service, which was supposed to cost $50, I was surprised to be charged $100.

Review.Titre: Scam
Review.Contenu: . I’ve been waiting to be approved for over a month just to find out the Secretary of State has approved my LLC.  They over charge for “expedited processing” and it still took me twice as long as it would if I filed myself. And I still don’t have my EIN number. Save yourself the trouble and go through secretary of states processing

Review.Titre: Absolutely the worst
Review.Contenu: Absolutely the worst. I paid well over a thousand dollars. They are supposed to help you. Their logo generator is TRASH please use canva instead. What sold me was their tax and accounting help. I have reached out to Avalara and gotten NO RESPONSE from them. It's pretty much diy so WHY DID I PAY SO MUCH!? Please, do yourself a favor and just look into taxes on your own and file for your own LLC and business banking. Their options are limited, did not meet my needs and the third-party tax assistance is ridiculous. I have already had to pay late fees multiple times because I was not aware that I would have to file monthly. I am now figuring it out on my own and wish SINCERELY that I had not spent all this money on this CRAP. The steps are as follows:1. Find information about taxes both local, state, and federal (speak with your local SBA they can assist). 2. File for your LLC or sole proprietorship (there are many online options like Legal Zoom)3. Find a domain name and hosting package you like. Make it simple if you are a retailer and go with shopify from the start. 4. If you want branded stuff or need to design your logo etc. Go with Canva. Overall, your cost will be MUCH lower and your results MUCH higher.

Review.Titre: Bait-and-switch... Cannot recommend
Review.Contenu: I should have probably read the negative reviews before going ahead with Tailor Brands, but lessons learned... I needed an LLC quickly with the EIN. I opted for the express service and paid what I thought was the total price of ~$275 for everything that was listed. After completing the payment, I had to fill out additional information. The form did not allow me to use a 3rd party agent, which I intended to do, because it is cheaper than paying Tailor Brands to do it ($49/year versus $199/year from Tailor). After I submitted everything, I was then charged an extra $99 for the EIN... Which I was under the impression that I had already paid this. I would not have moved forward if I had known this $99 was going to be tacked on after I paid.Finally, the LLC has been formed and as I'm going through the operating agreement, I see it's a generic template with NONE of my actual information put into it. What a joke.You're better off taking the time to do this yourself or go with a company that's not going to bait-and-switch you.

Being told before processing that it's all included to be told the day you submit that its not. I would like to know ow if there is any means to fix this. But all and all the lady I spoke with today was trooper she needs a rais she was more transparent with about my business from the get go I have hard time understanding something but she made it to were I can full understand what all the charges are and what was included with the 404.Update they did lie about the 404 the state charg is included in the 404. But after 7 to 8 Phone calls and lie after lie im just gunna give them till monday to stop the bs or i will do a charge back and claim fraud on the company

Review.Titre: Sneaky Wording for paid services
Review.Contenu: I created an an LLC with the PAID option to have expedited filing. Now there is a expedited filing with my state where it takes 1-2 business days to be processed. My status has been in state processing for more than 2 weeks. They will lie and tell you that this is out of their control. However, if they weren't sneaky and used expedited filing as it seemed to be worded when I bought it, I wouldn't be here leaving this review. My guess is that the "Expedited filing" was just through Tailor Brands side, and basic filing through state.After this review, they agreed to give me the expedited filing refund. They are quick with customer service on that aspect. But this shouldn't need to go this far to get a refund with this reasoning, adding an extra star because I stand by my opinion but thank them for refunding and hope they make a change to that expedited filing section.

Review.Titre: Paid Lesson learned
Review.Contenu: You can't charge someone expediting fees when you can't expedite the deliverables.  Got charged Agent Fee first day, another amount for obtaining an EIN, got charged for setting up a mailbox that never worked, literally. Yet, I had to paid for (Elite Plan) to expedite (what a laugh) and all the other addons and I am still in the same place from where I started a week ago... Had to cancel the service w/n refund for a pointless service. Paid for a report that explains whether a company needs a licenses, etc. and going into another week and received nothing... Logo's can't be created on HiRes so the end product looks less than desirable... I just don't know - should have just went with Northwest or LegalZoom. at least they can justify the $1000 which they provide embosser seal tool, quality binder too. don't bother getting a hold of customer service... they are clueless.  what they are on top of is getting one to add Trademark service as the cherry on top. quite frankly... they need a reset.  I should have checked the reviews on Trustpilot first... because elsewhere they were being talked up...

Review.Titre: Not worth it
Review.Contenu: 2 transactions totaling $547.Llc name had the word gifts put it in even though the name I requested was available. Now I will have to file amendments with the state to correct. Used taylor for convenience but wish I would have done it thru rhe state site for just small fees.

Review.Titre: I had my subscription on autopay pay but…
Review.Contenu: I had my subscription on autopay but my email and website were unaccessible due to "no payment received". I lost some important emails and probably potential customers for my business. I would look for another host elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Just a review
Review.Contenu: I wrote to get help on my request regarding the inclusion of e-commerce on my site but it took more than 3 days to get a feedback. It only when I wrote back complaining that I was well taken care of

Review.Titre: I just need a State certificate to…
Review.Contenu: I just need a State certificate to prove that my LLC has been registered and approved by the State of South Carolina. That’s it!

Review.Titre: SCAM.
Review.Contenu: This is a total scam. I advice everyone not to subscribe to any service from Tailor Brands. Once they get your credit card, they start charging for stuff you never ordered, and then refuse to give you a refund. At most, they offer you "credit" on their store, which you don't need.As soon as I subscribed for creating an LLC, before even finishing the process, someone called me and offered me a tax advice service. I declined. The next day, I woke up with a $660 charge on my card for the annual subscription, and not even the cheapest plan.I sent them 4 emails, and every response was either something like "I will forward this to [xxx] department, but are you sure you don't want it?" or "I understand your frustration, having a business is hard. We don't do refunds for your purchases but in this case we can offer store credit".After writing this review, the company finally issued me the refund, so I edited from 1 to 2 stars. I am still leaving this review because I firmly believe that this compulsory charging is how they operate, and I find it unacceptable. I'm sure some people end up accepting the service instead of complaining. The only reason they accepted to refund me was due to this review, which should have not been necessary on the first place.

Review.Titre: I am not a customer
Review.Contenu: I am not a customer.  I get the feeling I should be thankful for that.  After beginning the process, putting in my desired company name and all, I received a phone call from their customer service.  I was taken aback by that since I just put in my phone number only a few moments prior to the call.I don't know the first thing about starting a business but I can tell when someone is too eager.  I let him know he was being aggressive and he let me go with an offer of availability to talk when I'm ready. Were it not for this site, I would not know about the high percentage of 1 start reviews.  A good company shouldn't have the second highest review stat @ 1 star.  A healthy company would have a sharp cascade from 5 to one.  Thank you all for your reviews, especially Sam.  Your eloquence speaks volumes.P.S.  I wonder what rubber stamp rely I'll get ? =]]

Review.Titre: There's better
Review.Contenu: It will get the job done but you will experience numerous website glitches, store builder glitches, billing issues and support will take a long time to respond. You will also have domain issues and issues losing your logo completely or it being hidden or replaced with another

Review.Titre: Very frustrating experience dealing…
Review.Contenu: Very frustrating experience dealing with customer service. If your application is simple with no complications then Tailor Brands is fine, otherwise avoidUpdated my review to two stars from one star only because one customer service executive (Laurie i think her name was) went above and beyond to find and resolve the issue - the resolution was to get me a full refund. Still wouldn't use Tailor Brands again but grateful for Laurie's service

Review.Titre: Overpriced services and web site…
Review.Contenu: Overpriced services and web site applications that aren't easy to use for those who may not be technically inclined. The worst part of the experience was the difficulty I had to go through to get a refund of money for a service that although it wasn't cancelled before the due date, it was one day after AND it was for a mailbox that was inaccessible anyone. The plan subscription was cancelled timely, the domain expired therefore a refund for the mailbox should be automatic. As a new online business owner I have learned to be more careful jumping into service agreements especially for yearly subscriptions. Tailor Brands is in the business of making money, just as I am but you need to be clearer and more upfront about your cancellation and refund policies. Your reviews are terrible regarding these issues. Thanks for the experience. I've learned better and I'll be more cautious moving forward in my decision making.Yulisa Benitez (Tailor Brands)Jul 11, 2023, 19:44 GMT+3Hi Angie,Thank you for your reply, this is Yulisa from the LLC team. Normally, when someone buys a Business Mailbox from us, it can't be refunded. But, it's great that you reached out to us so quickly because we can cancel Mailboxes up to 5 days after they were purchased.  I see that that is the case here, so I can cancel the purchase for you and apply store credit to your Tailor Brands account with the amount you paid.  You can then purchase a new Mailbox or a different service from us using this credit. Just let me know as soon as possible if you'd like me to proceed with the cancellation.  I'm here to make things as easy and stress-free as possible for you!Best,YulisaTailor Brands Solutions TeamTailorbrands.com

This caused me to have to email each customer and refund them for the items that were not in stock. Had this issue never occurred or fixed in a timely manner, I would have not had to deal with these issues. Hopefully I don't have to deal with this issue again.

Review.Titre: No bang for the buck
Review.Contenu: I am all for up-and-coming brands. I first purchased a logo and then a 2-year domain and website. I paid for an expert website builder and got basic support. Never used my store! Then I cancel the subscription a day before renewal and they still charged me because I did not deactivate the page. BOOOOOOOOO. All money is not good money. keep the $155.88, I will never do business or recommend you all for any business.

Review.Titre: Make sure you cancel on time…
Review.Contenu: Make sure you cancel otherwise you will have a very difficult time getting your money back. It was the worse experience having to beg for a refund the same day they put a charge through. You can create a logo, but it’s not free. And once you do sign up, constant emails about this and that for a business. Wanting to sell you a domain to registering your company. Can’t be mad about them trying to make money, but the effort I had to put in to get my 9.99 back was astonishing considering they had just charge the card a minute before I emailed to cancel.

Review.Titre: Lady seemed to be rushing me over the…
Review.Contenu: Lady seemed to be rushing me over the phone. I didn’t care for that

Review.Titre: I HAVE NO LEGAL DOCUMENTATION FROM THE…
Review.Contenu: I HAVE NO LEGAL DOCUMENTATION FROM THE STATE OF NEW YORK REGARDING MY BUSINESS REGISTRATION. NOT ONLY THAT NOTHING FROM THE IRS WITH MY EIN. THIS IS SO DISAPPOINTING. I PAID FOR A FULL SERVICE AND BASICALLY GOT NOTHING.

Review.Titre: Upgrade
Review.Contenu: Very dissatisfied with the upgrade I made to the 12 month plan at 71.88. You are not able to get a refund either. This was the only thing I wanted to make and I am out 71.88 and still have no business card! I tried to reach out for help, I did not get any response. If you are thinking about using this company, please please please read all of the TERMS and CONDITIONS! Would not recommend at all and will be writing to the BBB.

Review.Titre: Payment Issues
Review.Contenu: The Service itself was good, the logos worked well and im happy with that side of it. The billing was quite manipulative. I was presented with two options, yearly subscription for 3.99 a month (total $47-48 a year) or a $9.99 a month subscription, which is what i chose as i just needed to use the tool short term. Once i clicked pay and signed it up to my paypal subscription service, i was charged an annual service at 9.99 a month, a total of $73 USD. The company doesnt have a live support tool either so i'm waiting nervously for news of a refund. Happy to change this review if the refund is smooth.

Review.Titre: I pay for the yearly subscription
Review.Contenu: I pay for the yearly subscription, and have business cards printed. Not the best quality. Then they ask if my logo looks blurry and I have the option of paying more for a detailed version of the logo I already own. Not impressed, if I had known, I would have gone with a different company.

Review.Titre: Decent products but hidden charges
Review.Contenu: UPDATE: I ended up being able to communicate by email with two team members/AI to discuss my problems and received a 50% refund on a product that automatically renewed without my say so. I think that’s a decent outcome and I’m happy to update my review from one star to two.###You can’t contact this company easily. Terrible creeping up of auto renewal with no clear way to stop it. Insincere signposting of where to ‘contact customer support’ - there is not a clear way to contact Tailor Brands. I’ve only seen a contact email here on the replies to the bad reviews.

Review.Titre: Subscribe and forget
Review.Contenu: Beware of the 'subscribe and forget' business practices. By the time you catch on that you had a subscription TB will have charged you a few months and refuse to refund. They do not provide notifications of upcoming charge / renewal like any other decent company does. I give them two stars for this reason, but I did end up creating a logo however I will not use it. The platform does have limited designs once you slot yourself into a category.

Review.Titre: I purchased a year subscription and…
Review.Contenu: I purchased a year subscription and keep scheduling appt to have help to build my website but nobody actually calls. It seems to be a waste of time and money so far. If someone can reach out, that would be great

Review.Titre: Taylor brands is geared toward getting…
Review.Contenu: I wrote a very bad Review and then I decided to delete it even though it was true because I don't need the bad karma. Use at your own risk

Review.Titre: The logo design is beautiful and easy…
Review.Contenu: The logo design is beautiful and easy to use so I give you another star. What gets me is advertising. Why say you only are going to charge for the month of 9.99, AND THEN charge ANOTHER $50 again on top of that? What's the purpose of paying for the month???? That's false advertising and bad business and honestly, I don't think I'll be using them in the future if they cant uphold their end of the deal.

Review.Titre: Me cobraron de manera ilicita los…
Review.Contenu: Me cobraron de manera ilicita los 71.88$ ya que solamente deseaba por un mes pero me salio un correo de confirmacion sobre ese valor directamente a descontado de mi tarjeta de credito, deseo mi devolucion de este servicio, por favor. They illegally charged me $ 71.88 since I only wanted for a month but I got a confirmation email about that value directly discounted from my credit card, I wish my return of this service, please.

Review.Titre: Very poor service
Review.Contenu: Very poor service. Rude customer service. Expensive. VERY hard to cancel subscription. No reminder when direct debit was going to be taken to allow option to cancel. The actual logos are ok but the rest of the package- customer service, option to cancel, the 'subscription' feature is all about making money with little regard for customers. I would avoid- I wish I had.

Review.Titre: Scam! I thought this bad practice is dead, but apparantly, it is not!
Review.Contenu: It is defacto standard, that if a customer clicks on a button that just says "Upgrade" without any further information, then the customer expects to see a price list first and then maybe buys the product. IT IS NOT EXPECTED that the site just charges my credit card without with some random amount without further questions. EDIT: customer support came back and did refund the full amount. I won't get back my time, though. Any website that does not provide transparency on prices should be banned, it would be only fair to companies that act lawfully.

Review.Titre: Don't make payment until you've read all the T&C'S!!!!
Review.Contenu: It clearly stated that amendments can be made after purchase to certain aspects. It would not let me even change a colour or font as stated. Customer services very poor, did not utilise the logo purchased and walked away a few British pounds lighter. A real shame as the logo only required a few tweaks.Update; I contacted Tailor Brands with my details, but they choose not to reply.

Review.Titre: On the fence
Review.Contenu: On the fence. It seems that they wanna help yet try and sell you the highest package going. After reading most reviews on here it seems the majority of "5 star" reviews have been invited which I can only assume they have been paid for or given Free Access. Sounds shady

Review.Titre: automatically charged forever.
Review.Contenu: I created a logo using tailor brands  (that was nice) and somehow managed to enroll in a monthly subscription.  I have tried to change it for a year. I send messages every month begging to be cancelled- no response. No way to access my account.  Every month the 9.99 comes out. I have been charged over $100 at this point that I have no ability to cancel.

Review.Titre: They charge for a service you didn't subscribe to
Review.Contenu: Like many others, I was also charged an annual fee, that I didn't sign up for. They did refund me, but they didn't want to admit that there is a bug in their signup flow, and the refund was missing almost a dollar. No big deal, but really does make the company very untrustworthy.

Review.Titre: Nice Design But Untrustworthy Platform
Review.Contenu: The design was nice. What I thought was a one time purchase somehow turned out to be a recurring charge. I have been charged for the last 2 months and just noticed it this month. When i reached out to them it took longer than the 24-48 hours they say it will take for a response and they did not address my refund at all. Unless you want to keep paying for something months after your use of it, even with no activity on your account, I would look elsewhere. I dont trust Tailor Brands and wouldn't recommend them to anyone.

Review.Titre: I've paid for Premium
Review.Contenu: I've paid for Premium, but am getting no response to emails so I can get things up and running. It's fine to say there's a 24-48 hour turnaround time, but that's too slow for my purposes. I wanted a month's membership, but could only buy a yearly subscription. I took it because I liked the logos, but disappointed with this outfit. I'd look elsewhere in future.

Review.Titre: i didn't understand what i am buying…
Review.Contenu: i didn't understand what i am buying and it doesn't seem that you had the interest of me really knowing what I am buying.it makes me sad. hope you will explain to your customer in plain English what they're subscribing to.

Review.Titre: Beware Tailorbrands sneaky subscription…
Review.Contenu: Beware Tailorbrands sneaky subscription auto-renewal. They wont work with you to refund the fees after the fact. Greed>Customer serviceThere are better tools out there...

Review.Titre: A 'read the small print' customer support
Review.Contenu: The product is alright (hence 2 stars) - but the customer service is annoying. Asked for a refund as they charged me for another year although didn't use the product. Had no idea, noticed in the statement (know that feeling?).... The customer support team pointed to 'unfortunately our company policy' and to read the small print. No refund. Only after sharing the UK Consumer Rights link they decided to offer a 90% refund (kept one month..). 1. Offer a refund without the threat if you care about your customers.2. Offer a refund if clearly someone is not using the service but the subscription was not cancelled!!3. Treat your customers as if you want them to recommend you and come back to use your product.4. Move to a 'We're not di*ks' company policy.

Review.Titre: Their design tools lack the freedom of creativity needed in branding.
Review.Contenu: I am a customer of theirs and decided to create my logo on their website. Their customization tool lacks versatility, customization and autonomy. It forces you to choose from automated font options that refresh every time you choose a new style. Your basic "Bold" "Underline" "Italics" options are not available for you to use on your OWN logo. It's very hard to believe that a company who's selling point is their logo design tools does not include the basic properties of digital design. I would not recommend them.

Review.Titre: Cancel your auto renewal
Review.Contenu: I created a logo using tailor brands (that was pretty cool) and somehow managed to enroll into a yearly auto renewal  subscription. I attempted to cancel only a few days after my card was charged and ask for a refund. They refused to give me my money back. I understand that your a subscription like Spotify, pandora and other companies. However, they take care of there customers and do what’s right. Not stand firm behind a sentence. Customers services isn’t just a timely response, great content but understanding And listening to your customers. Beware and cancel your subscription!

Review.Titre: Total Scam artists
Review.Contenu: Sure, it works. But when I tried to order a one month subscription on the most basic plan available, they automatically bumped me up to a one-year long membership for literally no reason. When I emailed them (because apparently you can't call them for reasons unknown) they said that they'd "be happy to change me over to the basic plan" but I've been waiting for my refund and switch to the month to month for about 2 weeks now and nothing has happened. Now I'm out $70 that I didn't have and they're taking their sweet time. I'll say this once and only once. DO. NOT. USE. THIS. SITE. Total scam.

Review.Titre: Great logos but a waste of money for everything else
Review.Contenu: Great logos and I love mine. However, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY on the other services. It is unnecessarily hard to set up a basic landing page and you are better to just get hosting with GoDaddy or another company and hire someone from Fiverr to set up a landing page. The business deck templates that are supposedly branded often use weird versions of your logo. And you only get one choice of deck presentation while I feel you should get at least 5. You cannot use your own domain for your business email which makes no sense. I bought my domain elsewhere before I created the logo with Tailor Brands. So I can't use their business email. I basically paid $50 just for the logo when I could have paid $33.

Review.Titre: I have tried to make contact with …
Review.Contenu: I have tried to make contact with company about my files but haven't received an email back with reassurance.Paid monthly expecting logo to be in my hands.I like the site and they have great ideas. Communication is a fail so far to resolve my issue.

Review.Titre: I signed up for a basic package through…
Review.Contenu: I signed up for a basic package through Tailor Brands today . I recieved an invoice for a basic package to my email . i then get an email with an invoice for a premium package and my card has also been charged. I didn't sign up for a premium package and if i clicked on a feature that wasn't included in the basic package it didnt warn me and say it would charge me more for using that particular feature. I've sent the company an email and am awaiting a response.Update - they refunded me immediately and the customer service was good . I have a feeling they act in bad faith generally though and upgrade an account without the account holders knowledge and see what upgrades stick .

Review.Titre: Hi The Tailor Team!
Review.Contenu: Hi The Tailor Team!I wrote you guys for help as Tania, I explained you situation and set you the invoices. Waiting for your response, I would like to highlight i want the subscription for 1 month not for the year  Thanks..

Review.Titre: Im very frustrated with this company
Review.Contenu: Im very frustrated with this company, i signed up for the premium logo package and immediately had problems i can not even login to my account. i can not download my logo i cant do anything inside of my account. i never received anything in my email even confirming my purchase! i keep getting a "design break" error message every time i try to login and when i was logged in i received the exact same error message.  i have reached out to customer support and have not received a single email back. i was very excited about my logo and really need it ASAP i am extremely upset that i payed $130 and have nothing to show for it!

Review.Titre: Decent Product/Horrible Customer Support
Review.Contenu: Decent product but customer service is HORRIBLE.  Nearly every one of their competitors offers real-time chat customer support, yet Tailor Brands has an email only support that can take an entire day or more to hear back on.  Insane.

Review.Titre: Not happy with D no full name
Review.Contenu: So I’m in the process of my website and I’m not happy it’s been nearly 2 weeks and “D.is very sketchy on his copy and paste skills and returning emails I feel like my project is held hostage. I’m not happy

Review.Titre: Limited to no communication
Review.Contenu: We used this company to develop our logos. While the automated logo generator was pretty easy to use to get a logo, it is limited in its ability to correct the logo. Minor mistakes could not be fixed because the program hadn't been adjusted for it. In our case, one of the logo letters was lower cased even though we capitalized it when typing. We couldn't fix it because the program would not correct it and there was no one to actually speak to at tailor brands to correct the mistake. This was why we gave the company 2 stars. It is very hard to reach a human at this company. Chat is a bot that cannot deal with any specifics. No person. I also had a billing issue and could not get in touch with any humans. Very bad business practice. If you offer a service, especially in customizations, customers should be able to speak to someone if they need help.

Review.Titre: They took a bit more money than I…
Review.Contenu: They took a bit more money than I thought I agreed toAnd when you bought the design, it was not a lot you could do with itA bit disappointing when you pay for a service like that

Review.Titre: Good tools for making a brand but i got…
Review.Contenu: Good tools for making a brand but i got scammed with their subscription services. Bought a single month and they upgraded me to a year sub without my knowing or consent.

Review.Titre: Horrible customer service
Review.Contenu: Horrible customer service. There seems to be no sense of urgency to resolve issues. I’ve experienced issues with the shopping cart on my site twice 1) the cart disappeared from the mobile site 2) when customers click the cart on the mobile, tablet and desktop site it takes them to the homepage instead of the cart. The second issue is ongoing. So, at this time my customers are unable to complete their order. It would be nice to have a phone number for support. Sending emails causes a  delay with getting issues resolved. When support has a question and you reply, it takes hours for them to respond to your reply. No orders completed = money lost for my company.Date: December 4, 2022This is a response to Tailor Brands comment below. The support team has not provided a solution. When I reached out yesterday for an update I was told they are still investigating.

Review.Titre: They try to reap you off once you link…
Review.Contenu: They try to reap you off once you link your card to the site, Tho the app is great but they charge you for what you never requested and tell you no refund.

Review.Titre: A handful of disappointments
Review.Contenu: I recently upgrading to the premium plan thinking I would be able to change up my logo colors and whatnot only to find it keeps redirecting me to a "design break" page no matter what I am trying to change. I've been emailed back several times to no avail about fixing the problem. When I upgraded I tried to redeem an August50 code that would give me 50% off the regular price and I checked my bank account only to be charged the full price. The person who emailed back said the code was not redeemed and that she could apply that code to the next year's premium charge. Smh. Is this a joke? I end up paying $90 for the full premium plan only to be ripped off with technical issues that cannot be resolved. I would advise anyone, who were to ask me about this company, to "redirect" themselves to a different, more reliable branding website. Now I'm thinking I should have went with my first option of a branding website instead of my second. Utterly diasspointed.

Review.Titre: warning:unrequired subscription activation
Review.Contenu: The design of the logo war fair, but i ended up with an unrequired monthly subscription to a unrequired service. very bad conduct!

Review.Titre: Wrong zip code on my stamp twice
OVER CHARGING MY ACCOUNT
Review.Contenu: OVER CHARGING MY ACCOUNT, I use the logos but after some time they keep charging and you cannot unsubscribe on site

Review.Titre: Hidden fees, not for all customers
Review.Contenu: All I wanted was the logo that I created. Tailor Brands offers all other kinds of services, but for the logo they advertise is $9.99 for a 1 time fee- fair enough. Then, within a matter of hours I was charged an ADDITIONAL $61.89! I didn’t sign up for anything. I reached out to the company and got 2 responses that it was my fault for "upgrading" thats why I was charged more money.  Computers can be weird so I thought sure, maybe it was me. So I went back through the checkout process, twice, to see where I went wrong and to find the "Upgrade" option. That didn't exist. I emailed back and forth to finally get someone to agree to refund my money that was blindly tacked onto my order. The other weird thing was, the next day, my banks fraud department called me to ask if I placed that charge.. I explained the situation and they said they would watch it for a few days to see if I got the refund. They refunded me... $0.43 and my bank confirmed there was no further initiated refund. So we did what we had to do. Hope your experience is better than mine!Update 1/6/20: Thanks for your reply, Tailor Brands. I did email you back quite a few times, not sure why you said I didn’t. You also said you’d refund my money and you sent me a refund invoice for $0.43.. not $61.89. Looking forward to your reply.

Review.Titre: Management Challenged
Review.Contenu: Good quality product, good delivery.TERRIBLE and nearly NONEXISTENT cancellation policy.

Review.Titre: Poor experience overall -- deceptive business practices
Review.Contenu: Bad experience overall.    Deceptive renewal process.  Product itself is average.  The best you can hope for is an OK image.  Image widgets are all cookie-cutter stuff.  You cannot move on without "accepting" the design and then you can't make changes.   Image creation requires a subscription, which is essentially your actual fee for your image, since you are paying them for a non-service.  This allows them to market on legal websites as a free service add on when you're creating your company.   Since the subscription isn't your image fee, you don't get anything for free.  The (free) image fee is like $3 and the subscription is $40+   Documentation states that you can cancel at any time if you are no longer interested in the service, but my experience was very different.  From all appearances, they just sat and waited and hoped that you don't cancel your subscription. They will automatically renew you after your service term with no warning and they will not refund.   $80 a pop for an automated design...not good value.  If you get this referred to you as a free product from somewhere else, BEWARE.....  (****DID ISSUE REFUND AFTER NEGATIVE REVIEW****)****UPDATE****  After writing the negative review above, which I have also voluntarily softened, I was refunded my renewal money in full and offered a full year of service free of charge, so in the end, Tailor did make things right, and they did so politely and without placing any customer-facing blame (which is credit-worthy and difficult to do!!!).  It earned them another star, but it shouldn't have to be that way.   I do not intend to use the free service, as I would be holding them hostage.  Done is done.

Review.Titre: Watch out for their subscriptions as they renew without warning
Review.Contenu: I loved my logo and subscribed to their service; life went on the venture didn't work out.Haven't used this company for the good part of a year and without any warning have been charged for my yearly subscription.I understand that this is how a subscription works but pretty much every other subscription service gives you a renewal email or warning stating that money is about to be taken out of your account as your subscription is about to be renewed.I Asked for a refund within the same day as their terms and conditions state a refund after 14 days. I also told them I had cancelled my subscription and asked if they terminate my account could I get a refund instead of having access for a year.Their support team told me that it's a subscription service and gave steps on how to cancel which I had already told them I had done. So I reiterated that I wanted a refund and that my subscription had been cancelled.A day went by with no reply, so I send a follow-up email the next morning and they respond offering me a 50% refund. I don’t see why a full refund would be an issue, they just state “Understand that we show the subscription nature of our site at all times”. Yes, I knew it was a subscription I was just asking for a refund as I’m in a difficult place and would have cancelled if I knew the £190 was about to be taken from my account without warning.The customer service is like pulling teeth, slow and painful. The product itself isn’t bad but nothing special.  But the company seems to just use this subscription service to profit off unexpected customers as a lot of other reviews on here state.UPDATE:They've come back to me and given me a full refund which I'm happy about. I feel like a lot of these negative reviews could be avoided if you sent out a renewal email.

It's also unconventional because it doesn't have any phone number to contact support everything is done though chat or email and I have mixed feelings about that. Overall it's a good site to start a business for someone whose just getting started

Review.Titre: Be careful to read the fine print
Review.Contenu: Be careful to read the fine print. The platform is fairly easy to use is the one plus. The negatives include no live person to speak with pertaining to business and the company is not fully transparent as to billing. A lot of the services autorenew and there is no notification prior to the actual auto renew date. In addition, you have to go to several different pages in order to cancel separate parts of the subscription .And apparently there are no refunds.I would say it is very misleading.

Review.Titre: I definitely like how easy it was to…
Review.Contenu: I definitely like how easy it was to purchase and set up the LLC. At times I felt communication was lacking especially because I am a new small business owner. I wanted to be able to talk with someone over the phone and not have to do a “live chat” as sometimes what I was trying to relay to TailorBrands representatives weren’t understood. However, I do like the logo that I was able to create on the user-friendly webpage.

Review.Titre: Rep annoyance
Review.Contenu: The customer service rep was extremely hard to understand, she kept mispronouncing my name and was very pushy. When I said no the first time that didn’t mean ask me 4 more times. The idea of the service is great, but the call before I was even done going through the forms to purchase it was not ok. I was in the credit card purchase screen and they were going to try and sell me on the phone or web no matter what. I did not like this process I should have had the option after I was done to call somebody not for somebody to talk at me, not listen and try and upsell me on every last thing.

Review.Titre: Relentless and dishonest upselling
Review.Contenu: Relentless and dishonest upselling.  They repeatedly try to tell me not buying more stuff is not compliant with my state's laws.  Luckily I know better but I fear for people who don't.Edit to add on 5/3/23:  Their response below says I didn't get back to them.  You want to know when they sent this message that i didn't get back to?  36 MINUTES AGO.  On what planet is that giving me enough time to respond?? Dudes.  Please re-evaluate your whole customer service approach.  Harassment does not get the results you want. I promise.ETA 5/4/23:  They refunded me so we're good.  Just some (unsolicited) parting words of advice:  if your customer service department could come close to matching your marketing in terms of quality, you guys would be unstoppable.

Review.Titre: Not the best experience.
Review.Contenu: Be prepared to spend somewhere in the tune of $1000 to start. This means getting all the legal paper work out of the way, custom domain, website etc. As i began my journey with Tailor brands it felt as if i was being upsold the entire time through a series of funnels. Why they advertise on youtube that getting set up with tailor brands is faster than making an omlette is beyond me needless to say that is not the case. I must admit I did get buyers remorse mostly because of the reviews i saw online and their false advertisment.  6 hours later, I emailed tailor brands to cancelled everything and naturally i asked for a refund. After two 30 minute on the phone, several emails which included 3 different reps denying my refund i finally got it.. I figured if its this frustrating getting a refund i cant imagine their customer service. Tailor brands i hope you are reading this and know that training your reps to lie to customers who experience buyers remorse into bullying them to stay with your services is wrong. Do better.

Review.Titre: Subscription service is questionable
Review.Contenu: Paid $7.99 for a logo and branding for a family members birthday party. Think step and repeats and napkins type stuff. Small things needing logos and branding but made it more fun. Signed up with Tailor Brands, paid the $7.99 knowing it was a subscription and I’d cancel it the next month after the opening month charge and if I forgot I’d be out $20 total ($9.99 a month) the next month. Well, 15 months and $150 later found out they don’t notify you via email like every other major subscription service (Netflix, HBO, ISP’s, etc). So you continue to get charged and don’t know.  According to their customer service they notify you in the notification center within the website only. They don’t send you anything after you sign up and just wait for you to figure it out. Tried multiple times with them to get any type of partial refund and NO is all they say. The email I signed up with didn’t have a login and their password reset link didn’t work so I didn’t even have access to the notification Center where I was supposedly told I was still paying for the subscription. When I asked to cancel the subscription, they didn’t. Had to talk to another person who finally cancelled it and then told me the opposite and said they do send emails to the members direct email but when I told them I never received any such emails was still told no. Do not work with this company. They bank on people forgetting it’s a subscription and make it difficult for you to be aware you’re even being charged. The way it was handled makes me believe this is how they operate purposely. Look on other review sites. I’m not the only one. Once they get in, they want to keep their charges under the radar til, like me, years have gone by.Update….., they’ve refunded my money only since I submitted this review. Unfortunate it had to come to this but they assured me there are emails on subscription renewal sent to your main email.

Review.Titre: The responses are automated and ignore…
Review.Contenu: Edited* after I posted my review a customer service rep reached out to me and actually helped solve a lot of the problems I had with my service.( see below) but since then the company has been much better. I have to say the trademark department . In particular called and really made sure to walk me through the process answer questions and get everything in a timely manner. I’ve raised my rating from 1 to an 3, I want to say 4 but…That said I do believe they need to make the expediting process more clear. When they say do it in 4-5 business days they mean that they will submit it in that time, versus them taking 4 weeks to submit the form you already filled out and could very easily submit yourself in less time , this is still the main reason that one star is missing because it literally makes zero sense. The reply team should also be more attentive and pay attention to what is written to them. * originalThe responses are automated and ignore anything you write. The page is unclear and misleading, you WILL be overcharged and for things that are  redundant. They will then ask you to review or ask how service was then ignore you. My review went from 6 to 1 after the service was rendered because of the customer support team being ridiculous and ignoring everything I asked or said. If they actually listened it would be a great company and service but it is just a robotic reply machine.

Review.Titre: Beware Shady Billing Practices!!!!
Review.Contenu: Be very aware what you do with this site.  Last year I tested it for a logo, and ended up paying $71 for a logo I didn't use.  I didn't know at the time they also signed me for an "annual subscription". 2 days ago I see a charge for $71.88.  I wrote to ask for that to be refunded and they refused.  Haven't used the service cancelled account and still they refused to refund my money.  Don't use these folks, they will find some way to take your money in ways you hadn't thought of.  Stay safe out there! UPDATE:  After posting this review TB did escalate my ticket and indeed did finally refund the $ in question, in full.  Never too late to do the right thing. Thank you.

Review.Titre: I am a new user of TailorBrands and I was…

I accidentally paid an annual subscription for the wrong design and I wrote emails to their team to help rectify. Its taking a bit long for me to get a clear answer. The correct design is under a monthly subscription and I would like if this was considered for the paid annual subscription instead of the wrong one.2. I had my card deducted for this month without any notification. If we users could easily find a place in our accounts to cancel our subscriptions it would be great. 3. Review.Titre: refunded My subscription charges. Thank you.
Review.Contenu: They have an auto renew subscription which is an annual charge.   Mine renewed without ever having an email to inform me it was about to and then I cancelled it immediately and they wouldn’t refund the money even though I literally cancelled my subscription on DAY ONE of the renewal. Finally someone said they will only refund 50% of the $60 I was charged. They need to have a courtesy email to tell people the subscription is about to renew because clearly this happens a lot. Or at least have it expire and remind people to renew if they want to. After going back and forth a few times they decided to refund the entire amount. I’m satisfied with this and hopefully they can adjust their policies to stop having angry customers in the first place.  Thanks for the refund.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed with this company
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed with this company. 1) Automatically registered for subscription service although only wanted the service for a single year to try them out. 2) I received so many emails from company, but conveniently (for them) no email regarding renewal of  service. I find that dishonest, but thats my opinion. 3) two days after renewal i message customer service regarding refund. I am advised thats not in company policy. So i should pay $200 dollars for a service i do not want.Honestly, I'm very disgusted by companies without morals and conscience. This is one company i think you should avoid.***update I was offered a 50% refund, which i accepted. Customer service was quick and did their best to assist. I would only recommend to the company that transparency builds trust. It is better to inform your customers of upcoming obligations,   if you have a good product they will stay. But i understand its about business.

Review.Titre: I really do want to give it 5 stars... but
Review.Contenu: MAN!  I want to give this service 5 stars.  I do!  BUT the information on the support site is not complete and there is no way to get a simple question answered.  I paid for 1 year of premium services and I am totally frustrated with having a hard deadline to get a horizontal version of the super whami-dyne  vertical logo I designed there and not being able to get the algorithm to spit out the proper font or edit the logo I own into a different configuration!  Yes, I sent the appropriate email to customer support (which warns you that if you send more than one you get bumped to the end of the line every time) but waiting up to 48 hours for a simple answer of "You can't do that." or "Oh, go here!" is truly peeving me.  A serious lack of customer support.  For a company that has the computer generate the logo selection and requires minimal staffing, Tailor brands could add the human element into the experience by having a phone number for guidance.  The support pages are not very clear on editing your purchased logo and from other reviews I am reading now it seems I am not the only one who has experienced this.

Review.Titre: Bad experience, customer service addressed it.
Review.Contenu: 10th December Update:-------------------------------------------The company reached out to me and offered to refund half and subsequently refunded me the full amount. I wish I did not have to go through the process. Suggestion to tailorbrands, you have a good product and it is equally important to manage the customer experience. Thank you for the refund!-------------Initial Review--------------I wish I had seen the trustpilot reviews before getting on to this site for building my logo.Victim of subscription game. I was charged 19.99$ recurring. I reached out asking for a refund and cancel the service. No response. I reached out to paypal and paypal declined my request since there is a billing agreement somewhere.Helping customers make them come back... nailing them, nails the brand. Learn to manage your own branding before trying to manage brands for customers.Good luck!Some other details: Even though they say, pay us and we will let you modify your logo, they truly dont. For the 2 times I had to change my logo, I had to reach out to customer care and their response was more like, we will let you make a change as a favor.Stay Away!!!!!

Review.Titre: This rating might have been higher had…
Review.Contenu: This rating might have been higher had I not decided to build a website on their site. If you find a logo and branding that you like then go for it but don't sign on for more features as thats where the headaches begin.There is no instant customer service just an email which isn't the slowest response time but makes it more frustrating when you have follow up questions to then have to wait a day.My issue I have reached is attaching an external domain to my website on tailor brands it just wont connect i asked customer service what information i needed to give my provider to connect the two and was sent a generic step by step thats on the help centre for connecting a tailor brand site to a tailor brand domain. I also asked how to use my SSL certificate but this along with my actual question was ignored based on the response i would was the CS person just sent a generic response without reading the contents of my email.Their logo design system is simple and easy to use the marketing tools and step by step they have for creating your brand is really user friendly but in terms of using them to host or use their web builder use an alternative well established provider.

Review.Titre: Very informative,

Review.Titre: Ann tailorbrands
As the costumer: better study up on domains, websites, IoT, etc... else your expectations might be in for it, no one can make it that easy.
Review.Contenu: Everything looked promising until I needed to connect my domain to my website. Both of which you create through Tailor Brands Business Guide Process. I follow their "Help Center" which tells me to change a few things in the DNS Domain settings. Then, it tells you to contact Tailor Brands Support, which I did...repeatedly, and they don't do anything other than ask what I need help with.   I also sent pictures of the steps I taken. When you go to publish your website it asks for your url/domain, which I put in, and it says it's a licensed site(my site). Then, it publishes the website using an irrelevant url anyway.    Hard to reinforce my branding, make my website easier to recall, or convey what the website is all about if the url doesn't make sense. They keep telling me to repeat things and say that their FAQ is wrong. In the end, I have to forward with masking which didn't make sense, considering how pointless their Step-By-Step guide is that makes you "Select" your domain, then forwarding to your "free" website domain. Why am I paying for a domain when they make your website publish/connect to a free alternative?  They tell you to change some CNAME and A settings that point to the heroko design website. When I type in my domain, it brings me there. This is telling me I should be able to connect my actual website, but Tailor Brands is avoiding the issue. Update: They tell me more things to do that I already tried. My domain is useless since publishing to it doesn't do anything. I don't want to mask since it makes the site look less transparent. Oh well, at least the customer service is nice about it and "seem" to be making an effort.Updated Conclusion: Customer Service is decent and the services are okay, but the outcome isn't as expected.

Review.Contenu: The chat agent did well in what they could do however I think the company can improve on advertisement as I feel EXTREMELY mislead. Especially considering that the chat agent could only offer a 50% refund less than 24hrs from purchase of product. The LLC formation is on hold yet they couldn’t allow him to cancel the whole order and issue a refund. I’ve been a chat agent before so I can’t blame the service but I’m disappointed in this company as it was highly reviewed. The fees were not laid out in an easy to understand manner and I feel scammed. I worked hard for my money.. I’m heartbroken.Edited to add: The company reached out immediately so I have moved the rating from 3 to 4 stars. The only reason it’s not a 5 is because of the hassle for a refund however I do think if you have the budget this is a good service. Just read everything CAREFULLY and know what you need for your LLC

Review.Titre: Deceptive policies and procedures
Review.Contenu: Update 4 star: they finally refunded my money  only after emailing 4 times with supporting documents and creating this review. Ultimately it was this review that got them to refund my Money. I let them know that I would update my review accordingly but would not take it down- I want to be transparent when it comes to these companies and their practices/ policies. Original review 1 star : I attempted to terminate my subscription previously and believed it had been successfully canceled. However, I received an email on the 14th notifying me that my subscription would be renewed on the 15th. On the same day, I responded to the email, explicitly expressing my non-authorization for the renewal and reiterating my request for cancellation. Contrary to the information provided in their email, my credit card statement indicates a deduction of $170.99 on the 14th.Subsequently, I sent another email with supporting evidence, highlighting the unethical nature of their practices, and requested a refund along with the immediate cancellation of my subscription, as previously communicated. Regrettably, the responses I received appeared automated, expressing apologies for any confusion and hoping it did not cause significant inconvenience.

Review.Titre: They were a real help
Review.Contenu: They were a real help, no doubt. I had this odd situation where I'd submitted my application to the Department of Commerce, but it was radio silence for months, despite paying the NY State fee. So, out of impatience, I reached out to Tailor Brands. They walked me through the whole application process, which surprisingly went pretty smoothly.Given my circumstances, they waived the $199 registered agent fee for a year, which was a good deal. Also scored a holiday discount, making it even better. So far, I'm satisfied with how things turned out thanks to their assistance.
